post.title: People on the left these days . . .

body:
You've had fevers before, sure. But  the reason this one spread so much is because people are contagious BEFORE they get a fever.    And you an I are largely immune. Might be a bad flu, but it's not going to kill us.  No, I'm isolating and wearing a mask to save grandma's life.  It judo-plexes your memory cells and turns your immune system against itself. The more experienced your immune system, the more it fucks you up.   So kids are thankfully safe. 

Smaller rural places are more safe the more isolated they are.  But I'm betting we're going to have news stories about pockets of outbreaks across rural america for years after this.  

It really is tapering off in NY and Jersey, where it peaked a month or so ago. But it's spiking in Florida and Arizona. Because people are idiots. "mandatory" doesn't make everyone suddenly play nice with each other.  

I don't think anyone expected it would last this long. If anyone told you 6 weeks, that was patented bullshit and you shouldn't listen to them for predictions.  What I don't get is that there were confirmed cases in Arizona and Florida (and most everywhere). Well past the point we could isolate the carriers and trace contacts.   .....Why didn't it explode with the arc like it did in NY, Jersey, and every European nation?    

I've got this suspicion, and don't quote me on this, that some places were simply too good at lockdown. They halted the spread of the disease... But that merely delayed it.   So now they open up and there's a spike.    Ultimately with a plague this contagious and airborn, everyone is going to get it or they're going to get a vaccine.    I'm still not hearing solid dates for when people will actually get vaccines.    So shit sucks.   And maybe you're right, and all those early cases in AZ and FL were just false positives. body_html:
You've had fevers before, sure. But the reason this one spread so much is because people are contagious BEFORE they get a fever. And you an I are largely immune. Might be a bad flu, but it's not going to kill us. No, I'm isolating and wearing a mask to save grandma's life. It judo-plexes your memory cells and turns your immune system against itself. The more experienced your immune system, the more it fucks you up. So kids are thankfully safe.

Smaller rural places are more safe the more isolated they are. But I'm betting we're going to have news stories about pockets of outbreaks across rural america for years after this.

It really is tapering off in NY and Jersey, where it peaked a month or so ago. But it's spiking in Florida and Arizona. Because people are idiots. "mandatory" doesn't make everyone suddenly play nice with each other.

I don't think anyone expected it would last this long. If anyone told you 6 weeks, that was patented bullshit and you shouldn't listen to them for predictions. What I don't get is that there were confirmed cases in Arizona and Florida (and most everywhere). Well past the point we could isolate the carriers and trace contacts. .....Why didn't it explode with the arc like it did in NY, Jersey, and every European nation?

I've got this suspicion, and don't quote me on this, that some places were simply too good at lockdown. They halted the spread of the disease... But that merely delayed it. So now they open up and there's a spike. Ultimately with a plague this contagious and airborn, everyone is going to get it or they're going to get a vaccine. I'm still not hearing solid dates for when people will actually get vaccines. So shit sucks. And maybe you're right, and all those early cases in AZ and FL were just false positives. But it's there now.

body: I'm not looking to debate the legitimacy of the masks, but the point is the US government is not supposed to have that power, and the fact that they did it so quickly and without consent shows that they hold a lot more power than they let on and can probably take all your rights away if they really wanted to (and they do, but it would mean tarnishing their image).

parent.body:
Do I have a right to sell tainted meat, or water from the toilets to my customers? Or should the health department maybe step in when it comes to... matters of public health? 

How 'bout clean water in general? How's that tap treating anti-maskers? I somehow doubt they're all completely self-sufficient. Point is, a centralized state isn't taking away a right, they're looking out for public health in general. It's not political. It's not personal. It's common damn sense and decency.

body: No they can’t, the “where does it stop” argument is always bad. Consent doesn’t matter here, it’s a representative democracy, you don’t get an active choice. Nobody would cry they didn’t consent to wearing pants because it’s a stupid argument. I hope you wear a mask and stay safe, please refrain from “where does it stop” arguments from now on.

body:
You are literally making excuses for unlimited statism and mob rule. The US government is indeed a representative democracy, but it's *supposed* to be a very limited one. Of course it keeps getting around that and getting bigger all the time, and that's the problem. What you're arguing for is very similar to communism in that the individual doesn't matter at all.

If a store owner wants people to wear a mask they have every right to kick out those who don't. But the government needs to stay extremely limited if we're going to have one at all, as it's very dangerous and can easily become tyrannical.
body_html:
You are literally making excuses for unlimited statism and mob rule. The US government is indeed a representative democracy, but it's supposed to be a very limited one. Of course it keeps getting around that and getting bigger all the time, and that's the problem. What you're arguing for is very similar to communism in that the individual doesn't matter at all.

If a store owner wants people to wear a mask they have every right to kick out those who don't. But the government needs to stay extremely limited if we're going to have one at all, as it's very dangerous and can easily become tyrannical.

parent.body: I'm not looking to debate the legitimacy of the masks, but the point is the US government is not supposed to have that power, and the fact that they did it so quickly and without consent shows that they hold a lot more power than they let on and can probably take all your rights away if they really wanted to (and they do, but it would mean tarnishing their image).

parent.body:
You are literally making excuses for unlimited statism and mob rule. The US government is indeed a representative democracy, but it's *supposed* to be a very limited one. Of course it keeps getting around that and getting bigger all the time, and that's the problem. What you're arguing for is very similar to communism in that the individual doesn't matter at all.

If a store owner wants people to wear a mask they have every right to kick out those who don't. But the government needs to stay extremely limited if we're going to have one at all, as it's very dangerous and can easily become tyrannical.
parent.body_html:
You are literally making excuses for unlimited statism and mob rule. The US government is indeed a representative democracy, but it's supposed to be a very limited one. Of course it keeps getting around that and getting bigger all the time, and that's the problem. What you're arguing for is very similar to communism in that the individual doesn't matter at all.

If a store owner wants people to wear a mask they have every right to kick out those who don't. But the government needs to stay extremely limited if we're going to have one at all, as it's very dangerous and can easily become tyrannical.

post.title: People on the left these days . . .

body:
It's really annoying to wear it all the time during work, nobody does it and keeps it at their chin. Wearing masks while physically somewhat engaged sucks and seems. I've tried several (cheap) masks but always end up having headache or being dizzy after wearing them for many hours.

Wearing them for 10 mins is no problem though. 

Also just the notion governement can force me to wear those masks all the time at work or risk an insane fee and even jail after 3 times (Belgium). 

A good way to see how annoying it is, is to do a small jog while wearing a mask.
body_html:
It's really annoying to wear it all the time during work, nobody does it and keeps it at their chin. Wearing masks while physically somewhat engaged sucks and seems. I've tried several (cheap) masks but always end up having headache or being dizzy after wearing them for many hours.

Wearing them for 10 mins is no problem though.

Also just the notion governement can force me to wear those masks all the time at work or risk an insane fee and even jail after 3 times (Belgium).

A good way to see how annoying it is, is to do a small jog while wearing a mask.

Also I do think it's fucking stupid that there's fines/jail time for not wearing them.

post.title: People on the left these days . . .

body: In the US we are at 1/10th of the death rate we were at when the pandemic was at its peak, and yet people are getting freaked out more than ever because the media tells them case spikes that aren't accompanied by death increases are a bad thing. If you think reality has anything to do with when things go back to normal, you are naive.

parent.body: I'm not looking to debate the legitimacy of the masks, but the point is the US government is not supposed to have that power, and the fact that they did it so quickly and without consent shows that they hold a lot more power than they let on and can probably take all your rights away if they really wanted to (and they do, but it would mean tarnishing their image).
